channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Ticketmaster hack may affect more than 500 million customers
item.description: A group of hackers claimed this week to have stolen 1.3 terabytes of Ticketmaster user data, including names, addresses and credit card information.
item.content:encoded:
A group of hackers claimed this week to have stolen 1.3 terabytes of Ticketmaster user data, including names, addresses and credit card information.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Display of a captured wolf in a Wyoming bar brings outrage
item.description: All of Wyoming is facing criticism after a man there displayed a wolf he captured in a bar.
item.content:encoded:
All of Wyoming is facing criticism after a man there displayed a wolf he captured in a bar.

(Image credit: Caitlin Tan)
item.dc:creator: Caitlin Tan

item.title: In a historic election, South Africa's ANC loses majority for the first time
item.description: In South Africa, a seismic moment comes as the ruling African National Congress party loses its absolute majority for the first time.
item.content:encoded:
In South Africa, a seismic moment comes as the ruling African National Congress party loses its absolute majority for the first time.

(Image credit: Zinyange Auntony)
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Akinwotu

item.title: Discounting is back in fashion, as Americans get tired of paying more
item.description: Consumer spending rose only slightly in April, as shoppers pushed back against rising prices.
item.content:encoded:
Consumer spending rose only slightly in April, as shoppers pushed back against rising prices.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: A trailblazing feminist says Mexico’s ‘triumph’ of a first female president is no surprise
item.description: What does the prospect of Mexico's first woman president and feminism in the country mean for Elena Poniatowska?
item.content:encoded:
What does the prospect of Mexico's first woman president and feminism in the country mean for Elena Poniatowska?

(Image credit: Israel Fuguemann )
item.dc:creator: Jan Johnson

item.title: Chants of 'intifada' ring out from pro-Palestinian protests. But what's it mean?
item.description: Chants calling for “intifada” have been a prominent feature of pro-Palestinian student protests. It’s a charged word whose use is perceived differently by people with opposing views of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.
item.content:encoded:
Chants calling for “intifada” have been a prominent feature of pro-Palestinian student protests. It’s a charged word whose use is perceived differently by people with opposing views of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

(Image credit: Adrian Florido)
item.dc:creator: Adrian Florido

item.title: The launch of Boeing’s crewed Starliner space capsule is called off yet again
item.description: The Boeing Starliner launch was halted with just minutes to spare. The mission to the International Space Station was to carry two NASA astronauts. Starliner has already faced years of delays.
item.content:encoded:
The Boeing Starliner launch was halted with just minutes to spare. The mission to the International Space Station was to carry two NASA astronauts. Starliner has already faced years of delays.

(Image credit: NASA)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: In Gaza, months of war have left Palestinians with barely the necessities to survive
item.description: Housing, medical care, schools, water and electricity are all in short supply in Gaza, which has endured a nearly eight-month siege by Israeli forces.
item.content:encoded:
Housing, medical care, schools, water and electricity are all in short supply in Gaza, which has endured a nearly eight-month siege by Israeli forces.

(Image credit: Omar Al-Qattaa)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Vermont becomes 1st state to require oil companies to pay for climate change damages
item.description: The state's Republican governor allowed the bill to become law without his signature. The move comes after the state suffered catastrophic summer flooding and damage from other extreme weather.
item.content:encoded:
The state's Republican governor allowed the bill to become law without his signature. The move comes after the state suffered catastrophic summer flooding and damage from other extreme weather.

(Image credit: Charles Krupa/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The Florida deputy who shot U.S. airman Roger Fortson has been fired
item.description: On Friday, the Okaloosa County, Fla., Sheriff’s Department said that Deputy Eddie Duran was fired following the completion of an administrative internal affairs investigation amid Fortson’s death.
item.content:encoded: On Friday, the Okaloosa County, Fla., Sheriff’s Department said that Deputy Eddie Duran was fired following the completion of an administrative internal affairs investigation amid Fortson’s death.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franklin
